readme:
# statwolf-logger
[![Build Status](https://img.shields.io/travis/Statwolf/statwolf-logger.svg?style=flat-square)](https://travis-ci.org/Statwolf/statwolf-logger)
[![Dependencies!](https://img.shields.io/david/Statwolf/statwolf-logger.svg?style=flat-square)](https://david-dm.org/Statwolf/statwolf-logger)
[![Package version!](https://img.shields.io/apm/v/statwolf-logger.svg?style=flat-square)](https://atom.io/packages/statwolf-logger)

This package provides a logger that can be connected with a remote machine. All
the log messages will be properly and selectively displayed in a dedicated buffer.

### Usage
When the package is installed, the logger will be automatically activated at the
startup of Atom. In the main menus, in **Packages** -> **Statwolf**, there is
an option for toggling the logger.

### Settings
* Log file location: specify the location for the log output file (defaulted as
the atom install folder)
* Log port: the logger port (defaulted as 2300)
* Log address: the logger address (defaulted as localhost)
* Log in developer console: specify whether to echo the log in the Atom dev console
* Log to file: specify whether to write the logs in the output file

metadata.name: statwolf-logger
metadata.description: Enable Atom with a remote logger for Statwolf
